Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This fragment of papyrus, which was found at Oxyrhynchus (P.Oxy. VII 1014) and which dates from the 3rd century of our time, contains an extract of Book IV (2-5) of the famous roman "Clithophon and Leucippe". This work, which has known great success since the age of antiquity, was by the hand of Achilles Tatius, an alexandrian write who lived in the 2nd century B.C. The copy was achieved at the back of an expired document dating from the 2nd century of our time.
